verb.description: Manage to obtain (something) by persuading or cleverly manipulating someone.
examples: I wangled an invitation to her party
I think we should be able to wangle it so that you can start tomorrow

noun.description: An act or an instance of obtaining something by persuasion or clever manipulation.
examples: a rather clever wangle on the part of some of the folk at the office

origin: Late 19th century (first recorded as printers' slang): of unknown origin; perhaps based on the verb waggle.
